I was trying to solve https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45901248/convert-dataframe-columns-value-into-digital-number using rank function.

Sorry, I typoed, I meant STT. You see in your code where you have startActivity? That means its going to be calling out to another program asynchronously. STT is extremely complicated, and usually involves sending the speech to a server for processing. You need to handle the asynchronous result, there is no way to return one synchronously.

The error means you have invalid JSON. .NET Core did not change the JSON specification. Read [ask] and show what the actual JSON looks like. You can just store `Response.g.Body.ToString()` in a separate variable to inspect it.

I ran into this, when trying to create a new helper method for an struct definied in an other package.I have (db)models, that have embedded structs for relations (sqlx). All models have an Insert method. To be able to create the method (in another package than models) i had to create a new type, but calling Insert called the method of the embedded struct. Even if i understand now, why this happens i'd like to understand why google implemented it this way.

Couldn't this lead to a realy mess, if you create new types of structs defined in external librarys? You have to know, if the struct embedds other structs, if not, you can't even say what methods will be called. I fixed this by creating a function right now, and for 1.9 i could use type aliases but still, why is it implemented like this?

Thanks for the response, @UncleO! Yes, you're right. The memory could be protected by setting BP to 5, 6, or 7. But` BP2` is writable and should be set. Also, if I send `11111111` and then read the status it returns the same wrong result(`00011000`). At least `SRWD` should be set. And if I connect the chip to `Arduino` all the bits of status register are set without problem

This is helpful but not exactly correct. There are more combinations than just what the cartesian product gives. The cartesian product would result in `[["A1","B1","C1"],["A2","B2","C2"]]`. However, the letters need not be in order, and some letters might not appear in one of the results at all. `["C1", "B2", "B1"]` is also a valid combination.
